greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Moebius transform of A010051, the characteristic function of the primes: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} mu(n/d)*A010051(d); A054525 * A010051.
comment: A010051 = A051731 * A143519 (since A051731 = the inverse Mobius transform).
A000720(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) floor(n/k) where A000720(n) is the number of primes <= n. - _Steven Foster Clark_, May 25 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Mobius transform of A010051, the characteristic function of the primes.
example: a(4) = -1 since row 4 of triangle A043518 = (0, -1, 0, 0).
mathematica: Table[Sum[MoebiusMu[n/d] Boole[PrimeQ@ d], {d, Divisors@ n}], {n, 89}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 19 2017 *)
program: return add(moebius(n/d) for d in D)
(PARI) A143519(n) = sumdiv(n,d,isprime(d)*moebius(n/d)); \\ (After Luschny's Sage-code) - _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 19 2017
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Aug 22 2008
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 19 2009
